ai.summary: Stage 04 of the London to Walsingham route covers 73.1 km through varied UK landscapes. Classified as hard, it tests stamina, navigation, and planning with a mix of urban sections, rural lanes, fields, and hedged footpaths. This stage is best tackled by experienced hikers with a solid fitness base and a well-planned itinerary.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of surfaces: urban and rural roads, compact gravel paths, grassy field margins, and occasional woodland. Elevation varies with gentle to moderate ascents and descents; surfaces can be uneven, soft, or muddy after rain. Anticipate gates or stiles, hedgerows, and exposure on open sections.
ai.safety_notes: Plan as a long day or multi-day hike with daylight considerations. Carry a map and compass or GPS, and share your route and ETA with someone. Stay visible on roads and be prepared for variable UK weather; bring waterproof layers and warm clothing. Ensure adequate hydration and nutrition, monitor fatigue, and rest as needed. Check for path closures and be mindful of livestock and remote sections with limited phone signal.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Water and high-energy snacks (2–3 L recommended)
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Phone with offline maps and portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) in the UK. Longer days and milder conditions are typical, with summer offering the most daylight but potential for crowds; autumn provides scenic scenery but can be muddier. Winter hikes are more challenging and weather-dependent.

seo.title: London to Walsingham Stage 04: 73.1 km Hard Hike (UK)
seo.meta_description: Discover Stage 04 of the London to Walsingham route. A challenging 73.1 km hike across varied UK terrain with safety tips, terrain overview, and gear recommendations.
